name: David Slump
subtitle: President & CEO
about: A battle-tested multi-cultural leader with a 30-year track-record of growth and turn-arounds in the Automotive and Energy industries. Leveraging diverse experiences across P&L leadership, operations, sales & marketing, and M&A roles to achieve demonstrated results in team building, innovation, execution, and customer/supplier relationships to accelerate profitable growth.
experiences: President Global Markets, Strategy and Services

Leading the day-to-day operations and financial performance of all HARMAN's business in Global Markets (~$2B Revenue with double-digit profit) in China, Japan, Korea, Russia, India, South and Central America. In addition, leading HARMAN's software services business with ~6,000 software engineers and mid-teen EBITDA margins. Leading the overall Strategy and portfolio management for HARMAN together with CEO. David is a member of the Senior Leadership Committee (SLC).​

Led the day-to-day operations and financial performance of HARMAN’s Connected Services business (~$1B with mid-teen EBITDA), the software and services business focused on automotive, enterprise and digital transformation. Also a member of HARMAN's Senior Leadership Committee (SLC).

Responsible for HARMAN's procurement spend of ~$5B across 19 manufacturing plants including nearly $1B in external manufacturing partnership spend. Drove ~$500M margin expansion through Procurement, Supply Chain and Manufacturing & Quality across HARMAN businesses.

Integrated the acquisitions of Cellnet Data Systems, Hunt Technologies and StatSignal into Cellnet+Hunt, a leading distribution automation and advanced metering communication solutions provider for utilities in North America.

Directed the development and execution of growth programs to accelerate organic growth and expand margins for a $19 billion supplier of power generation and energy delivery technologies.  Led a global team of product marketing, communications, regional market development and energy consulting.
Senior Vice President, Automation Division Business Development

Directed the development of a global strategy to re-focus ABB on Automation & Power Technologies.  Major emphasis was on portfolio management, growth agenda and competitive positioning resulting in the implementation focusing Automation into 3 core divisions with several years of profitable growth.
Directed $1.2 billion business serving electric, gas and water utilities in the United States with automation and power products & services.
Vice President, Medium Voltage Sales & Marketing
Directed global product marketing and regional sales for $1.1 billion medium voltage technologies business.

posts.post: At hashtag#Marelli we have recently launched a Student Design Sprint in collaboration with the Student Innovation Center - Iowa State University (USA).​​Last week, Marelli’s CEO, David Slump, and Ayman Karmi, Project Engineer spearheading the Sprint, visited the campus to kick off the call for entries. This unique opportunity is geared toward visionary students eager to design the cockpit of the future and help define how the next generation of consumers envisions interior personality. ​Over three months, selected winners will work closely with Marelli’s global designers and engineers in an open-innovation setting. Their task: develop prototypes that may reimagine the concept of vehicle interiors.​​Stay tuned for future details on this initiative as we follow its progress!

For me, China equals speed! Being in Shanghai and at the Beijing Auto Show this week was an impressive demonstration of a very dynamic market. Our team created an immersive experience, which received a lot of amazing feedback from the guests at our booth. We showcased our latest technologies enabling the software-defined vehicle, vehicle personality, vehicle performance and how Marelli is supporting OEMs in China through co-creation and design-led innovation at speed. Highlights included announcing a collaboration to integrate Marelli's innovative headlamp design with Hesai’s next-generation lidar technology to create the first-ever Lidar Lighting System. I really enjoyed great conversations with customers, partners and media from China, and abroad, on the opportunities and challenges in the world’s largest automotive market.  hashtag#Marellihashtag#BeijingAutoShow

I always enjoy being in Japan and last week was extra special. We had an amazing Innovation Marelli technology event in Yokohama, where we showcased our latest solutions enabling the software-defined vehicle, vehicle personality and sustainable vehicle performance. It was an honor to welcome our customers Nissan Motor Corporation and Honda, our lending banks in Japan, and journalists from Japanese media for tours of our exhibition.  I really enjoyed the conversations on current market trends as well as our approaches to co-creation and design-led innovation, which are resonating very well with automakers worldwide.
It was my absolute pleasure to recognize each of these deserving colleagues with the CEO Excellence Award for 2023.  Congratulations and keep up the inspirational work!!! hashtag#MarelliPeople

Happy New Year!  We at @Marelli are starting 2024 full of energy at @CES in Las Vegas where we will be taking our visitors on an exciting journey to design-led innovation.  I’m thrilled to share our vision for enabling the software-defined vehicle, and to demonstrate how we can put the power of personalization in the hands of automakers and vehicle owners.  I am proud of the amazing experience our team has created and look forward to many great conversations with our guests.

In January 2024, hashtag#Marelli will attend CES in Las Vegas with its latest innovations.​​Within our private, invitation-only booth at the Wynn Hotel, guests will participate in a Design-Led Innovation journey, stepping through the phases of the vehicle co-design process. Visitors will see how Marelli is enabling the software-defined vehicle revolution through our scalable hardware architecture, service-oriented software, and cloud virtualization technology, powered by AWS, QNX, and Qualcomm.​In our Digital Twin Studio, visitors can select vehicle features using an interactive app and see them come to life in a demo car. Our Co-Creation @ Speed area will showcase the power of our Digital Twin, capable of replicating an entire vehicle cockpit in the cloud. The concept accelerates design, testing, simulation, and feature deployment over the air. ​​“I’m excited to share our vision for the software-defined vehicle at CES in January, and to demonstrate how we can put the power of personalization in the hands of automakers and vehicle owners,” said David Slump, President and CEO. “Our focus on innovation, digitization, and technology, combined with the value of our strong relationships with AWS, QNX, and Qualcomm, allows us to create broad solutions for our customers at Marelli speed.” ​​Learn more: https://bit.ly/3Gvm8Nh.​​hashtag#CES2024
The countdown to CES 2024 has begun: experience Design-Led Innovation in Las Vegas, at the Wynn Hotel, from January 9th to 11th!​Join us at hashtag#CES2024!​hashtag#Marelli

Global technology company Altair and the Center for Automotive Research (CAR) named hashtag#Marelli a 2023 Enlighten Award winner for its “Lightweight Urethane for Interior Products”. Marelli was awarded in the “Future of Lightweighting” category. ​Marelli has developed a new lightweight polyurethane foam that can be applied to all foam-in-place (FIP) applications. It reduces weight by 40% with new tooling (8% with current tooling), decreases foam thickness by 50% and reduces raw material costs by 20%. The new foam also reduces the environmental impact of automotive production, through its reduced material usage per part, lower density, and 80% reduction in volatile organic compounds (VOCs).​This achievement is the result of a joint development with materials partner Covestro, aimed to create a more efficient and sustainable material, that led to a win-win result for both companies, customers, and vehicle owners. ​Read more: https://bit.ly/3DDc5V1.hashtag#AltairEnlighten hashtag#OnlyForward
